result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Certification of PLEAS HEARING transcript commencing MARCH 5, 2015, received and filed. (21 Pages)  Copy of transcript forwarded to:  ATTY DENNIS THORNTON, 230 W. WELLS ST., STE. 405, MILWAUKEE WI, 53203

Defendant Adam A Dronso in court with attorney Justin Singleton. Defendant Adam A Dronso in custody. Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk. 
Status conference held.
Justice Point Discharge Summary dated March 20, 2015, received and filed.

Defendant Adam A Dronso in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case 14CF5521 and 14CF259 for the purposes of sentencing.  Status conference scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated March 4, 2015, received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated January 29, 2015, received and filed.

Attorney Justin Singleton in court, defendant Adam A Dronso not in court, in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case held off the record for the purposes of Sentencing. Defense requests case be set for Plea and Sentencing. Case is adjourned for Plea and Sentencing on 3-5-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Justin Singleton in court, defendant Adam A Dronso not in court, in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Scheduling Conference. Parties address new case filed, 15CF259, Court adjourns case for Scheduling Conference on 1-30-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated January 20, 2015, received and filed.

Defense requesting that bail money posted, $1000.00 be returned to person who posted it.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court at this time.

Defendant Adam A Dronso in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Defendant Adam A Dronso in custody.  Ronald Dague and David Robles for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 1/13/15.

01-07-2015

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Adam A Dronso in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Adam A Dronso in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
